doc:
Barry Sullivan (American actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barry_Sullivan_(American_actor) 0 Patrick Barry Sullivan (August 29, 1912 – June 6, 1994) was an American movie actor who appeared in over 100 movies from the 1930s to the 1980s, notably The Bad and the Beautiful opposite Kirk Douglas. David Shipman wrote of Sullivan:
Barry Sullivan redefined the term "leading man", being neither a genuine star, although billed above the title, nor a character actor, since he was seldom called upon to play anyone but himself - nice and reliable, the old standby. There were many others of his generation competing for the same roles - Wendell Corey, with his somewhat charming gloom, the cynical but easygoing Van Heflin, the acquiescent but dangerous Robert Ryan. Many cinemagoers found the Sullivans and Ryans more rewarding than the bona fide box-office champs but, like them, they could be counted upon when it came to facing up to the great ladies of the screen. Another obituary said "Second division Hollywood actors like Barry Sullivan... are usually faintly praised for being reliable or solid. However, when given the chance, Sullivan was a powerful, often baleful presence on screen, providing more pleasure than many more touted stars. " Other critics saw Sullivan as the essential star who easily fit into whatever role he played. Patrick_Barry_Sullivan ( August_29_,_1912 – June_6_,_1994 ) was an_American_movie_actor who appeared in over_100_movies from the_1930s to the_1980s , notably_The_Bad and the_Beautiful_opposite_Kirk_Douglas . David_Shipman wrote of Sullivan : Barry_Sullivan redefined the_term " leading man_"_, being_neither a_genuine_star , although billed above the_title , nor a_character_actor , since he was_seldom_called upon to_play anyone but himself - nice_and_reliable , the_old_standby . There were many_others of his_generation competing for the_same_roles - Wendell_Corey , with his_somewhat_charming_gloom , the_cynical_but_easygoing_Van_Heflin , the_acquiescent_but_dangerous_Robert_Ryan . Many_cinemagoers found the_Sullivans_and_Ryans more_rewarding than the_bona_fide_box-office_champs but , like them , they could_be_counted upon when it came to facing up to the_great_ladies of the_screen . Another_obituary said " Second_division_Hollywood_actors like Barry_Sullivan ... are_usually_faintly_praised for being reliable_or_solid . However , when given the_chance , Sullivan was a_powerful_,_often_baleful_presence on screen , providing more_pleasure than many_more_touted_stars . " Other_critics saw Sullivan as the_essential_star who easily fit into whatever_role he played .
